title: Development (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Rural and Community Development and
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Rural and Community Development and 

the Gaeltacht (Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 2025.
text_norm: 1 order may cited rural community development gaeltacht (delegation ministerial functions) order 2025

title: Development (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order
heading: 2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of
text_raw:
2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of 
the Minister for Rural and Community Development and the Gaeltacht conferred 
on him – 

(a) 

by or under the provisions of the Acts of the Oireachtas specified 
in Part 1 of the Schedule, 

(b) under the instruments specified in Part 2 of the Schedule, and 

(c) 

by or under – 

(i) 

(ii) 

section 3A(b) of the Community, Rural and Gaeltacht 
Affairs (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2007 (No. 32 of 
2007), 

section 3A of the Community, Rural and Gaeltacht Affairs 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2007, in so far as it relates 
to the functions transferred by clause (i), 

(iii) section 32(1)(d)(ii) of the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous 

Provisions) Act 2010 (No. 28 of 2010), and 

(iv) section 32 of the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) 
Act 2010, in so far as it relates to the functions transferred 
by clause (iii), 

are delegated to Jerry Buttimer, Minister of State at the Department of Rural and 
Community Development and the Gaeltacht. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 24th June, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [267] 3

title: Development (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order
heading: Section 162 of the Public Health (Ireland) Act 1878 (41 & 42 Vict., c. 52)
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

PART 1 

Section 162 of the Public Health (Ireland) Act 1878 (41 & 42 Vict., c. 52) 

Educational Endowments (Ireland) Act 1885 (48 & 49 Vict., c. 78) 

Part VI of the Local Government (Sanitary Services) Act 1948 (No. 3 of 1948) 

Charities Act 1961 (No. 17 of 1961) 

Street and House to House Collections Act 1962 (No. 13 of 1962) 

Section 3 of Local Government Services (Corporate Bodies) Act 1971 (No. 6 of 
1971) in so far as it relates to the establishment of a body having functions 
relating to the promotion of water safety 

Section 42A of the Copyright and Related Rights Act 2000 (No. 28 of 2000) 

Dormant Accounts Act 2001 (No. 32 of 2001) 

Sections 49A and 128A to 128F, and section 4 in so far as it relates to regulations 
made under section 128E or to regulations made for the purposes of enabling 
section 128E to have full effect, of the Local Government Act 2001 (No. 37 of 
2001) 

Sections 66A to 66H of the Local Government Act 2001 

Chapter 3 of Part 9 of the Local Government Act 2001 

Section 127 of the Local Government Act 2001 

Unclaimed Life Assurance Polices Act 2003 (No. 2 of 2003) 

Paragraphs (a) and (b), and paragraph (f) in so far as it relates to the functions 
referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b), of section 2(1) of the Community, Rural 
and Gaeltacht Affairs (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2007 (No. 32 of 2007) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [267] 

Charities Act 2009 (No. 6 of 2009) (other than section 13 of, and Schedule 1 to, 
that Act) 

Dormant Accounts (Amendment) Act 2012 (No. 23 of 2012) 

Charities (Amendment) Act 2024 (No. 21 of 2024) 

PART 2 

Local Community Development Committee (Section 128E) Regulations 2014 
(S.I. No 234 of 2014) 

Water Safety Ireland (Establishment) Order 2019 (S.I. No. 56 of 2019) (other 
than Articles 5, 6 and 7 of that Order) 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

10 June, 2025. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [267] 5 

BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 
ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR
